Chicopee.Thomas D. Page House: The Thomas D. Page House, also known as the Belcher Lodge or the Chicopee Falls Masonic Temple, is a historic house at 105 East Street in Chicopee, Massachusetts, USA. The house was built sometime before 1875, and exhibits significant Queen Anne styling. In 1875, the house was owned by Amos Page, proprietor of the Page Knitting Needle Manufacturing Company. His son, Thomas C. Page, sold the property to the local Masonic lodge in 1909.
